meanings.definition: Exposure to too much of something, especially to the point of harm or negative consequences.
meanings.sent1: The overexposure to the sun led to a painful sunburn.
meanings.sent2: Her overexposure to loud noises caused damage to her ears.
meanings.sent3: The overexposure to cake at the party left him feeling sick.
meanings.sent4: His overexposure to the news made him anxious and stressed.
meanings.sent5: The overexposure to sugar resulted in a sugar crash later in the day.

meanings.definition: The act of exposing something to too much light or radiation.
meanings.sent1: The photographer was careful to avoid overexposure in his photos.
meanings.sent2: The overexposure of the film caused the images to be washed out.
meanings.sent3: The overexposure of the painting made the colors appear faded.
meanings.sent4: The overexposure of the plants to sunlight wilted their leaves.
meanings.sent5: The overexposure of the camera sensor resulted in a whiteout effect in the image.

meanings.definition: The state of being excessively publicized or widely known.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity's overexposure in the media led to fatigue among the public.
meanings.sent2: The overexposure of the brand in commercials made it lose its appeal.
meanings.sent3: The overexposure of the meme made it lose its humor over time.
meanings.sent4: The overexposure of the song on the radio made it annoying to listeners.
meanings.sent5: The overexposure of the product in advertisements made people skeptical of its quality.
